Class mysqlConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.mysqlConnection
  • public class mysqlConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has all the queries to the data base.

    • Method Detail

      • ConnectDb

        public static void ConnectDb​(java.lang.String[] args)

      • updateToDB

        public static java.lang.String updateToDB​(java.lang.String id,
                                          java.lang.String str1,
                                          java.lang.String str2)
        This method gets a subscribed client's ID and a value to update to the data base. The value can be the client's credit card number OR the client's subscriber number. The method returns a string that says if the update was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        id - - the subscribed client's ID
        str1 - - the subscribed client's credit card number OR the subscribed client's subscriber number (depends on str2)
        str2 - - "creditCard" / "subscriberNumber"
        Returns:
        "Update" (if the update was made successfully) OR "Error" (if failed to update)

      • getData

        public static java.lang.String getData​(java.lang.String id)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets a subscribed client's ID and return a string with the client's data. The data returned in the string is: the client's first name, the client's last name, the client's ID number, the client's phone number, the client's email address, the client's credit card number, and the client's subscriber number.
        Parameters:
        id - - the subscribed client's ID
        Returns:
        "Error" (in case the given ID not found in the data base) OR a string with the client's details (in case of success).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkForLogin

        public static java.lang.String checkForLogin​(java.lang.String username,
                                             java.lang.String password)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets a user's user name and password, checks if these are the correct values (according to the information in the data base), and checks if the user is not already logged in to the system. If so - changes the value in the data base that indicates that the user is logged in and returns a string with the user's details from the data base. The data returned in the string is: the user's ID number, the user's first name, the user's last name, the user's login status, the user's job, and the user's area (field name = note).
        Parameters:
        username - - the user's user name
        password - - the user's password
        Returns:
        "checkLogin Error" (in case the user is already logged in or if the user entered incorrect details) OR a string with the user's details (in case of success).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • logout

        public static void logout​(java.lang.String costumerID)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method logs out the user from the system. It gets the user's ID number and changes the value in the data base that indicates that the user is logged.
        Parameters:
        costumerID - - the user's ID number
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • productInLogation

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Product> productInLogation​(java.lang.String category,
                                                             java.lang.String facilityLocation,
                                                             java.lang.String clientStatus,
                                                             java.lang.String supplyMethod)
                                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method return an array with the information about the products in the chosen facility according to the chosen type of menu, the client's status and the chosen supply method. The information about the product includes: the product's name, product's ID number, product's image, product's price.
        Parameters:
        category - - the chosen category in the menu (all products / food / drinks / desserts).
        facilityLocation - - the facility from which the order is made.
        clientStatus - - the client's status - regular client or subscribed client.
        supplyMethod - - the type of order (on site / pick up late / for delivery).
        Returns:
        an array with the information about the products (in case of success) OR "Error" (in case no products found).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkExistsSaleInProduct

        public static java.lang.String checkExistsSaleInProduct​(java.lang.String productID,
                                                        java.lang.String facility_Area)
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method checks if there is a sale on a certain product in a certain area. If there is a sale, the method will return the new price of the product after the discount, otherwise the method will return "NotInSale".
        Parameters:
        productID - - the chosen product's ID number
        facility_Area - - the chosen area
        Returns:
        "NotInSale" (if there is no discount on the chosen product in the chosen facility) OR the new price of the product if it's on sale.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkProductQuantity

        public static java.lang.String checkProductQuantity​(java.lang.String facilityLocation,
                                                    java.lang.String productName)
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method check the quantity of a certain product in the chosen facility. If the product is not fount, the method will return "Error", otherwise the method will return the amount of the product in the chosen facility.
        Parameters:
        facilityLocation - - the chosen facility's name
        productName - - the chosen product's name
        Returns:
        "Error" (in case the product is not fount) OR the amount of the product in the chosen facility.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • updateQuantity

        public static java.lang.String updateQuantity​(java.lang.String facilityLocation,
                                              java.lang.String productName,
                                              java.lang.String quantity,
                                              java.lang.String updateType)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method updates the quantity of a certain product in the chosen facility. The update can increase or decrease the quantity of the product in the facility. The method returns a string that says if the update was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        facilityLocation - - the chosen facility's name
        productName - - the chosen product's name
        quantity - - the value by which to increase or decrease the quantity of the product in the chosen facility
        updateType - - the type of quantity update - increase or decrease
        Returns:
        "updateQuantity Update" (in case the update was successful) OR "updateQuantity Error" (in case the update failed).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addOrderDetailsToDB

        public static void addOrderDetailsToDB​(java.lang.String price,
                                       java.lang.String facility,
                                       java.lang.String costumerID,
                                       java.lang.String payment,
                                       java.lang.String productsInOrder,
                                       java.lang.String supplyMethod,
                                       java.lang.String orderContent,
                                       java.lang.String address,
                                       java.lang.String phone)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method updates the details of a certain order to the "orders" table in the data base
        Parameters:
        price - - the total price of the order
        facility - - the facility in which the order was made
        costumerID - - the costumer ID number
        payment - - the method of payment (credit card / EKT app / deferred payment)
        productsInOrder - - the number of products in the order
        supplyMethod - - the type of order (on site / pick up later / for delivery)
        orderContent - - the content of the order - the name of the product and its amount
        address - - the address (for distant orders for delivery)
        phone - - the phone number of the client (for distant orders for delivery)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getAvailableOrderNumber

        public static int getAvailableOrderNumber()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method get the order number for the next order it needs to enter into the orders table. The method checks what was the previous highest order number and returns its value + 1.
        Returns:
        the next available order number.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

                                            java.lang.String id)

      • updateClientStatus

        public static java.lang.String updateClientStatus​(java.lang.String id)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method upgrades the client status from regular client to subscriber. The method moves the clients data from the "clients" table in the data base to the "subscribers" table in the data base.
        Parameters:
        id - - the client's ID number
        Returns:
        "updateClientStatus Error" (in any case of an error) OR "updateClientStatus Update" (in case of success).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getUsersWithNoAccount

        public static java.lang.String getUsersWithNoAccount()
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets all the information about users without an account in the system (clients). The information includes: the user's user name, the user's password, the user's first name, the user's last name, the user's ID number, the user's credit card number, the user's phone number, and the user's email address
        Returns:
        "getUsersWithNoAccount Empty" (in case no users found) OR all the information about all the users without an account.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        public static java.lang.String CreateAccount​(java.lang.String id)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException

        Parameters:
        id - - the user's ID number
        Returns:
        "CreateAccount Error" (in case the user is not found) OR "CreateAccount Update" (in case an account was created successfully).

      • getAvailableDiscounts

        public static java.lang.String getAvailableDiscounts​(java.lang.String area)
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets the information about all the available discounts for a certain area. The information includes: the sale ID number, the product name, the start date and time of the sale, the end date and time of the sale, the original price of the product, and the new price of the product (after the discount).
        Parameters:
        area - - the area name
        Returns:
        "getAvailableDiscounts Empty" (in case there are no available discounts in the area) OR a string of all the information about all the discounts in the chosen area.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getDetailsForPaymentFields

        public static java.lang.String getDetailsForPaymentFields​(java.lang.String clientStatus,
                                                          java.lang.String id)
                                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets the client's credit card details. The details include: the name on the card, the number of the card, the card's expiration date, the security number at the back of the card.
        Parameters:
        clientStatus - - the client's status (regular client / subscriber)
        id - - the client's ID number
        Returns:
        "getDetailsForPaymentFields Error" (in case the client is not found) OR a string with the cliet's credit card details.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checktShowReports

        public static java.lang.String checktShowReports​(java.lang.String type,
                                                 java.lang.String month,
                                                 java.lang.String year,
                                                 java.lang.String facility,
                                                 java.lang.String area)
                                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets the information about the different reports. There are 4 typed of reports: orders, inventory, deliveries, and clients. The information about the reports inclines: the month of the report, the year of the report, the area of the report, the facility of the report, and the data for the charts in the report. Some of the reports need all this information, others need just some of it.
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of the report
        month - - the month of the report
        year - - the year of the report
        facility - - the facility of the report
        area - - the are of the report
        Returns:
        "checktShowReports Error" (if the report is not available in the data base) OR a string with all the information about the report.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getDeliverirsToApprove

        public static java.lang.String getDeliverirsToApprove​(java.lang.String area)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method gets all the details about distant orders for delivery that need to be approved by the deliveries operator.
        Parameters:
        area - - the name of the area
        Returns:
        "getDeliverirsToApprove Empty" (in case there are no deliveries that need to be approved) OR a string with all the details about the orders for delivery.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • approveDelivery

        public static java.lang.String approveDelivery​(java.lang.String orderNumber,
                                               java.lang.String estimateDeliveryDate)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method updates in the data base that a certain delivery is approved by the delivery operator.
        Parameters:
        orderNumber - - the number of the order
        estimateDeliveryDate - - the estimated date in which the delivery is expected to arrive
        Returns:
        "approveDelivery Error" (in case of an error) OR "approveDelivery Approve" (in case of a successful update)

        java.sql.SQLException

      • InitSale

        public static java.lang.String InitSale​(java.lang.String productId,
                                        java.lang.String productName,
                                        java.lang.String area,
                                        java.lang.String startDate,
                                        java.lang.String endDate,
                                        java.lang.String originalPrice,
                                        java.lang.String newPrice)
                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method creates a new sale on a certain product in a certain facility. The new sale is initiated by the marketing manager.

        productId - - the ID number of the product
        productName - - the name of the product
        area - - the area of the sale
        startDate - - the start date and time of the sale
        endDate - - the end date and time of the sale
        originalPrice - - the original price of the product
        newPrice - - the new price of the product (after the discount is applied)
        Returns:
        "test Error" (in case of an error) OR "test OK" (in case the sale initiation was successful).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addUser

        public static java.lang.String addUser​(java.lang.String id,
                                       java.lang.String firstName,
                                       java.lang.String lastName,
                                       java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                                       java.lang.String email,
                                       java.lang.String job,
                                       java.lang.String username,
                                       java.lang.String password,
                                       java.lang.String subscriberNumber,
                                       java.lang.String creditCard,
                                       java.lang.String status,
                                       java.lang.String note,
                                       java.lang.String isLogin)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is a "import external data" simulation - it takes all the external data and enters it into the data base (users table).
        Parameters:
        id - - the user's ID number
        firstName - - the user's first name
        lastName - - the user's last name
        phoneNumber - - the user's phone number
        email - - the user's email address
        job - - the user's job title
        username - - the user's user name
        password - - the user's password
        subscriberNumber - - the user's subscription number
        creditCard - - the user's credit card number
        status - - the user's status (employee / regular client / subscriber)
        note - - the user's area
        isLogin - - the user's login status (binary value 0/1)
        Returns:
        "Unable to add user to table" (in case of an error) OR "User added successfully" (in case of success)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addClient

        public static java.lang.String addClient​(java.lang.String nameOnCard,
                                         java.lang.String userName,
                                         java.lang.String password,
                                         java.lang.String expirationDate,
                                         java.lang.String cvv,
                                         java.lang.String firstName,
                                         java.lang.String lastName,
                                         java.lang.String id,
                                         java.lang.String creditCard,
                                         java.lang.String phone,
                                         java.lang.String email,
                                         java.lang.String approvedByManager,
                                         java.lang.String haveAccount,
                                         java.lang.String address,
                                         java.lang.String numberOfpurchases)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is a "import external data" simulation - it takes the external data about the clients and enters it into the data base (clients table).
        Parameters:
        nameOnCard - - the user's name on their credit card
        userName - - the user's user name
        password - - the user's password
        expirationDate - - the user's credit card expiration date
        cvv - - the user's security number on their credit card
        firstName - - the user's first name
        lastName - - the user's last name
        id - - the user's ID number
        creditCard - - the user's credit card number
        phone - - the user's phone number
        email - - the user's email address
        approvedByManager - - if the user's account is approved by the area manager
        haveAccount - - if the user has an account in the system
        address - - the user's address
        numberOfpurchases - - the number of purchases the user made in the system
        Returns:
        "Unable to add client to table" (in case of an error) OR "Client added successfully" (in case of success)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • checkIfThereIsReport

        public static boolean checkIfThereIsReport​(java.lang.String type)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method makes sure that no report is generated more than once.
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of the report (orders / inventory / delivery/ clients)
        Returns:
        true (if there is already a report for a certain month in a certain year) OR false (otherwise)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
